message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.MA. 

The paper deals with the problem of learning policies in Markov decision processes (MDPs) using an approximate linear programming (ALP) formulation. This is a common problem in machine learning and artificial intelligence, which suggests that cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are likely sub-categories. The paper also proposes a stochastic primal-dual method with the Bregman divergence to solve the ALP, which suggests that cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.SY (Systems and Control) are also possible sub-categories. Finally, the paper applies the proposed algorithms to a queuing problem, which suggests that cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems) is a possible sub-category as well.
